alert.note: Alert for Frederick (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 08 at 9:40AM EDT until May 08 at 6:59PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maryland... Monocacy River near Frederick affecting Frederick County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Monocacy River near Frederick. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, significant lowland flooding is occurring along the river, with backwater flooding also occurring. Numerous roads are closed. Water is approaching the parking lot at Gambrill Mill on the Monocacy National Battlefield. Backwater flooding from Carroll Creek is likely approaching the underside of the bridge leading to the Frederick city wastewater treatment plant. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:01 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 16.6 feet, or 1.6 feet above flood stage. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:01 AM EDT Sunday was 17.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 4.6 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.6 feet on 10/02/1979. - Please visit https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety information. && River Name Fld Observed Sun Sun Mon Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 2PM 8PM 2AM Stg Time Date Monocacy River Frederick 15.0 16.6 Sun 9 am 14.6 12.5 10.4 MSG unknown &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/washington or www.weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM EDT.
